NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Jewelry and Omnichannel or the cell corresponding to Books and Sales?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Books} and {Sales} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Jewelry and Marketing or the cell corresponding to Toys and Omnichannel?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Jewelry} and {Marketing} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Furniture and Sales or the cell corresponding to Apparel and Subscription?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Apparel} and {Subscription} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Furniture and Inventory or the cell corresponding to Beauty and Omnichannel?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Beauty} and {Omnichannel} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.52 to 0.56?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Furniture, Customer Service), (Furniture, Inventory), (Furniture, Marketing), (Furniture, Omnichannel), (Furniture, Online), (Furniture, Sales), (Furniture, Subscription)}.
